page.title: 01Western Enfield.
page.content: This is an area of contrasts, containing highly residential parts and the open countryside of farmland and recreational space. Since the imposition of the Green Belt,there has been little outward growth in housing.The majorty of homes are privately-owned and semi-detached, built between the two wars. There is little local industry and many commute into London to find employment.They are well-served for transport with two Underground and British Rail Stations. A few find work at the two hospitals through there are plans for an amalgamation in the 1990's. The area offers a variety of shopping facilities and a fair number of educational establishments and religions institutions.
